Question (English): How can I register as a Business User?
Answer (English): Visit the https://www.dubailand.gov.ae and select DLD Signup page, select the application, and follow the steps to complete the registration process.

Question (English): What applications are available for registration?
Answer (English): Applications include Trakheesi, RVS, RDC, Ejari, Mollak, Oqood , REES, API server etc

Question (English): Do I need to select an application during the registration process?
Answer (English): Yes, select the application you wish to register for.

Question (English): What information do I need to provide for registration?
Answer (English): Provide your Emirates ID number or use UAE Pass and complete the profile section.

Question (English): How can I register using my Emirates ID?
Answer (English): Enter your Emirates ID number, complete the captcha, and follow the prompts.

Question (English): Can I register using UAE Pass?
Answer (English): Yes, UAE Pass is a convenient option for registration.

Question (English): What should I do if I encounter a message stating my Emirates ID is already registered?
Answer (English): Try logging in. If the issue persists, contact support@dubailand.gov.ae.

Question (English): What is the purpose of the captcha during registration?
Answer (English): Captcha ensures that the registration is performed by a human.

Question (English): What should I do if I encounter an unknown error during registration?
Answer (English): Retry after some time. If the problem continues, email support@dubailand.gov.ae.

Question (English): How will I know if my registration was successful?
Answer (English): You will receive a confirmation email upon successful registration.

Question (English): Can I register for multiple applications at once?
Answer (English): No, you can register to one application from sign up page and after that you can login and request for access for other business applications from the dashboard.

Question (English): What are the profile questions I need to answer during registration?
Answer (English): Profile questions relate to your profile, business and contact information.

Question (English): Is it mandatory to complete the profile section during registration?
Answer (English): Yes, completing the profile section is required to finalize your registration.

Question (English): How long does the registration process take?
Answer (English): The registration process typically takes a few minutes if all required information is provided correctly.

Question (English): What should I do if I don’t receive the registration confirmation email?
Answer (English): Check your spam or junk email folder. If it’s not there, contact support@dubailand.gov.ae for assistance.

Question (English): Can I update my registration details later?
Answer (English): Yes, you can log in and update your profile information through the edit profile service.

Question (English): Is there a fee for registering as a Business User?
Answer (English): No, there is no fee for registration. However, service-specific fees may apply for services.

Question (English): Can I register as a Business User if I am located outside the UAE?
Answer (English): Yes, you can register online from anywhere, provided you have the required Emirates ID or UAE Pass.

Question (English): What should I do if I face technical issues during registration?
Answer (English): Contact customer support at support@dubailand.gov.ae for assistance with technical issues.

Open your UAE Pass app on your mobile device. and grant access to the portal.

Question (English): Who is the broker?
Answer (English): An individual who holds a commercial license for real estate brokerage activity and is registered in the Brokers Registry  to carry out real estate activities in the Emirate of Dubai, and whereby is allowed to conclude and complete deals or contracts in return for a certain fee agreed upon in advance with the client. There are two types of brokers (broker in real estate sales / broker in real estate rental). The broker must be registered in the brokers register and hold a broker card from the Real Estate Regulatory Agency. The role of the broker is concerned with preparing the matters related to the sale between the owner and the buyer, or the owner and the lessee, in return for a specific commission agreed upon by the two parties.

Question (English): What are the working terms for brokers?
Answer (English): The conditions for working in the field of real estate brokerage are: having a real estate brokerage license, registration in the brokers registry to obtain an office registration certificate, having a broker card, in addition to complying with the rules and regulations.
Question (Arabic): ما هي شروط العمل في مجال الوساطة العقارية؟
Answer (Arabic): شروط العمل في مجال الوساطة العـقـاريـة هي: وجـود رخـصـة وسـاطـة عـقـاريـة، التسجيل في سجل الوسطاء للحصول على شهادة تسجيل المكتب، والحصول على بطاقة الوسيط، إضافة إلى الالتزام بالقواعد واللوائح.

Question (English): Can individuals work as real estate brokers?
Answer (English): No individual has the right to practice real estate brokerage unless he applies for a license to practice through the relevant authority of the Real Estate Regulatory Agency.

Question (English): What to do if broker is unable to receive the token on login using registered mobile number?
Answer (English): Broker can a raise a support ticket at https://dubailand.gov.ae/en/contact-us/raise-a-support-request/.

Question (English): What is the maximum duration for Contract A while creating the contract?
Answer (English): The maximum duration for contract A at the time of contract creation is 1 year or 365 days.

Question (English): What is the maximum duration for Contract B while creating the contract?
Answer (English): The maximum duration for contract B at the time of contract creation is 1 year or 365 days.

Question (English): What is the maximum duration for ContractF while creating the contract?
Answer (English): The maximum duration for contract F at the time of contract creation is 6 months or 180 days.

Question (English): Can more then one broker from the same company create contract A on same property?
Answer (English): No, only one broker from a specific company is allowed to create a Contract A on a property.

Question (English): Is there any limit on broker commission?
Answer (English): There is no limit on broker commission if the broker enters the Amount, but there is a limit of 20% if the broker enters the commission in percentage.

Question (English): Who can cancel the contract?
Answer (English): Broker and the contract parties can initiate the contract cancellation.

Question (English): Can Approved contract be cancelled?
Answer (English): Yes broker and any party can initiate the contract cancellation on Approved contract.

Question (English): Who will pay the DLD fee?
Answer (English): The DLD fee will be paid by the party agreed upon in the contract.

Question (English): Who will pay the broker commission?
Answer (English): The broker commission will be paid by the party agreed upon in the contract.

Question (English): What to do if the contract party did not receive signature link?
Answer (English): Broker can resend the signature link using the Resend link button on contract detail page.

Question (English): Can Approved Contract F be extended?
Answer (English): Yes, Approved Contract F can be extended but the total duration of the contract F from contract start date should not exceed 9 month or 273 days.

Question (English): Can Approved Contract F be cancelled?
Answer (English): Yes, contract cancellation can be initiated on Approved Contract F.

Question (English): Can Expired Contract F be extended?
Answer (English): Yes, Expired Contract F can be extended but the total duration of the contract F from contract start date should not exceed 9 month or 280 days.

Question (English): Can broker edit and resubmit the contract once rejected by the company Admin?
Answer (English): Yes, broker can edit the contract and resubmit after rejection by the company Admin.

Question (English): How many contract A can be Approved at the same time for single property?
Answer (English): There could be only 3 contract A Approved for a single property at the same time

Question (English): What is contract auto cancellation?
Answer (English): If the contract party or broker do not take required action on pending contract, then system will mark the contract with Auto-Cancelled status.

Question (English): Can owner initiate the contract A on his property?
Answer (English): Yes, the owner can create contract A with the broker on his property through Dubai Rest mobile app. If the property has multiple owners then rest of the owner have to accept the contract and contract will be sent to broker for approval.

Question (English): Who can create contract F?
Answer (English): Only broker can create contract F.

Question (English): Can contract party initiate contract cancellation?
Answer (English): Yes, any of the contract party can initiate contract cancellation, but approval from the other parties and the broker is required for contract cancellation.

Question (English): Can contract party edit the contract.
Answer (English): No, contract party is not allowed to edit the contract. Only broker can edit the contract.

Question (English): What is the password for contract downloaded PDF document?
Answer (English): Contract's expiration date in the format DDMMYYYY.

Question (English): What will happen if any of the party do not take action on pending contract?
Answer (English): The contract will be marked auto cancelled if any of the party do not take action within 5 days.

Question (English): What to do if the party is unable to get the OTP on contract signature page.
Answer (English): The party can approve the contract using UAE pass as well. Make sure the contact number provided in contract details should match with the UAE pass. If UAE pass is also not working then raise a support request at https://dubailand.gov.ae/en/contact-us/raise-a-support-request/.

Question (English): Can contract broker be changed?
Answer (English): Yes, the contract broker can be changed and only company admins are allowed to change broker and the new broker must be from the same company.

Question (English): My phone number is incorrect or missing. What should I do
Answer (English): Contact the Emirates ID authority to update your phone number. We are not authorized to change the phone number associated with your Emirates ID

Question (English): What is the cost of using the Dubai REST app?
Answer (English): Downloading and using the Dubai REST app is free. However, certain services, such as property registration, transfer, or payment of fines, may require a fee. The app provides detailed fee information before proceeding with any transaction.

Question (English): Do I need to visit the Dubai Land Department (DLD) office to complete transactions?

Question (English): How accurate is the Rental Index data in the Dubai REST app?
Answer (English): The Rental Index is generated based on data from actual rental transactions in Dubai. The Dubai Land Department (DLD) aggregates this data from registered rental contracts, ensuring that the information is accurate and up-to-date. However, rental prices can fluctuate due to market demand, location, and property conditions, so the Rental Index should be used as a guide rather than a fixed value.

Question (English): What should the tenant do if landlord is forcing to evict before end date of contract?
Answer (English): If a tenant in Dubai is facing unlawful eviction by the landlord, the tenant must first approach the landlord and try to negotiate the issue. If the tenant is unable to come to a solution, with the landlord, the tenant has the right to file a complaint against him at the Rental Dispute Centre (RDC). While filing a rental dispute case in Dubai, tenants should ensure that they have all of the valid documents of their tenancy contract or Ejari Dubai system, latest DEWA bill, title deed copy, tenant’s passport and visa copy. Additionally, they should have UAE ID Card copy and any other supporting documents before approaching the RDC.

Question (English): Who is responsible for paying any service fees for a property?

You may be required to pay a contribution to the air conditioning fees, if the property is not set up to meter the consumption of each unit individually.  In this case, the charges are normally collected by the developer or owners association and not by a utility provider.

Question (English): What is the DLD Self Payment Portal?
Answer (English): The DLD Self Payment Portal is an online platform provided by the Dubai Land Department (DLD) that allows users to make payments related to property transactions, such as Ejari fees, Registration Trustee fees, property fines, RDC, Mollak service charges, etc., securely and efficiently.
Keywords: DLD Self Payment Portal, property transactions, DLD Payments, RDC Payment, Tabu Payment, Mollak Payment. Registration Trustee Payment, Ejari Fee.

Question (English): How can I access the DLD Self Payment Portal?
Answer (English): You can access the DLD Self Payment Portal through the official DLD website or by visiting the following link.
Keywords: DLD Self Payment Portal, property transactions, DLD Payments

Question (English): What payment methods are accepted on the DLD Self Payment Portal?
Answer (English): The DLD Self Payment Portal accepts various payment methods, including credit cards (Visa, MasterCard), debit cards, and Noqodi. You can select your preferred payment method during the checkout process.
Keywords: DLD Self Payment Portal, property transactions, DLD Payments, Noqodi

Question (English): How do I make a payment on the DLD Self Payment Portal?
Answer (English): To make a payment, visit the DLD self-payment portal, select the type of payment you wish to make (e.g., Ejari, Registration Trustees, Rental Dispute Center, Oqood, Mollak fees or fines), and follow the instructions to enter the payment details. Once confirmed, the transaction will be processed.
Keywords: property transactions, DLD payments, RDC payments, Tabu payments, and Mollak payments. Registration Trustee Payment, Ejari Fee.

Question (English): Is the DLD Self Payment Portal secure?
Answer (English): Yes, the DLD Self Payment Portal uses encryption and secure payment protocols to ensure that all transactions are safe and comply with industry standards for online payments.
Keywords: DLD Self Payment Portal, Secure Payment, Industry standards,

Question (English): Can I track the status of my payment?
Answer (English): Yes, once you have made a payment, you can check the status of your payment through your DLD portal account. A payment confirmation receipt will also be provided upon successful transaction completion as well.
Keywords: DLD payment status confirmation, payment receipt.

Question (English): How long does it take for my payment to be processed?
Answer (English): Payments made through the DLD Self Payment Portal are typically processed immediately. However, bank transfer payments may take a little longer to reflect in your account.

Question (English): Can I make partial payments through the DLD Self Payment Portal?
Answer (English): The ability to make partial payments may depend on the type of payment and DLD policies. For specific details, you should refer to the DLD guidelines or contact their support team.
Keywords: DLD payment guidelines, partial payments support

Question (English): How do I contact DLD if I need help with payments?
Answer (English): To submit your query, please send an email to info@dubailand.gov.ae with your full name and mobile number with details. DLD enquiries can also be made on a toll-free call centre number [8004488]

Question (English): What types of fees can I pay through the DLD Self Payment Portal?
Answer (English): You can pay various property-related fees through the portal, including registration fees, fines, service charges, Ejari fees, RDC payments, and other charges related to property transactions in Dubai.
Keywords: property transactions, DLD payments, RDC payments, Tabu payments, and Mollak payments. Registration Trustee Payment, Ejari Fee.

Question (English): Is the DLD Self Payment Portal available in languages other than Arabic?
Answer (English): Yes, the DLD Self Payment Portal is available in multiple languages, including English and Arabic, to cater to a broader user base.

Question (English): Can I make payments on behalf of someone else through the DLD Self Payment Portal?
Answer (English): Yes, you can make payments on behalf of someone else, but you will need to ensure that you have the correct property details and transaction reference. The payment receipt will be issued in the name of the person or entity associated with the transaction.
Keywords: payments on behalf of someone else, payment receipt

Question (English): Is there a payment deadline for property registration or other fees?
Answer (English): Yes, each type of payment, such as property registration or fines, has its own deadline. It is important to check the DLD website or your specific transaction details for the payment due date to avoid penalties or delays.

Question (English): Can I make payments for multiple transactions at once?
Answer (English): Currently, the DLD Self Payment Portal allows users to make payments for individual transactions at a time. If you need to pay for multiple transactions, you will need to complete each payment separately.

Question (English): Will I receive an invoice or receipt for my payment?
Answer (English): Yes, after completing your payment, you will receive an electronic receipt or invoice via email, which you can also download from your DLD portal account.

Question (English): What is the DLD Transaction Reference Number?
Answer (English): The DLD Transaction Reference Number is a unique identifier for each payment made through the portal. It can be used to track your payment status and is typically included in your payment confirmation email or receipt.
Keywords: payment transaction reference number, payment identifier, payment confirmation receipt

Question (English): Can I change or cancel a payment once it has been submitted?
Answer (English): Once a payment has been submitted and processed, it cannot be canceled. If you need to make any changes or have concerns, please contact DLD support for assistance, especially if you believe there was an error in the transaction.
Keywords: cancel a payment, error in the payment transaction.

Question (English): What should I do if I don’t receive my confirmation email?
Answer (English): If you don't receive your payment confirmation email, check your spam or junk folder. If it is not there, log in to your DLD portal account to verify the transaction. If the confirmation is still missing, contact DLD support for assistance.

Question (English): Are payments on the DLD Self Payment Portal refundable?
Answer (English): Refunds are not provided for any DLD payments. However, in cases where a customer makes a duplicate payment due to technical issues, they should visit the DLD customer support center and provide proof of the duplicate payment. After verification, the amount will be refunded to the customer through the same payment channel used.

Question (English): Can I pay my property service charges on the DLD Self Payment Portal?
Answer (English): Yes, the DLD Self Payment Portal allows property owners to pay Mollak service charges for their properties, including maintenance and management fees.

Question (English): Can I access my payment history on the DLD Self Payment Portal?
Answer (English): Currently, payment history is not available in the DLD Self Payment portal. However, this feature may be added in the future.

Question (English): What is Noqodi Payment Gateway?
Answer (English): Noqodi Payment Gateway is a secure and efficient payment processing system that facilitates online transactions in the UAE. It enables businesses to accept payments via multiple methods, such as credit cards, debit cards, and mobile wallets.

Question (English): What is Noqodi Wallet Payment?
Answer (English): Noqodi Wallet Payment allows users to make secure payments for various services, including government and utility payments, using their digital wallet within the Noqodi payment system. This system can integrate with government services, like DLD, for seamless transactions. For wallet registration, please visit the following link:
Keywords: Noqodi Wallet Payment, government payment services

Question (English): Where can I find the FAQs for Noqodi Wallet Payment?
Answer (English): Please use the following link for any FAQs related to Noqodi.

Question (English): Is there any Direct Debit Support in DLD for payment?
Answer (English): Ejari is now fully integrated with the Noqodi Direct Debit System (UAEDDS) to configure the rental payment schedule during the contract creation or renewal process. Please use the following link for more details.

Question (English): For what purposes can payments be made from the escrow account?
Answer (English): As a general rule, payments made from an escrow account are only for payments to the contractors, consultants, and marketing involved in the project.

Question (English): When can payment be made from the escrow account?
Answer (English): The account trustee engineer visits the site and checks the project to ensure the completion of the main construction phase. Upon verification of this, the account trustee is authorised to disburse payments from the escrow account to make payments to service providers.

Question (English): What is the Oqood Portal Fee for off-plan sales?
Answer (English): AED 1,000, paid as part of the developer registration process.

Question (English): What payment methods are accepted for real estate surveys?
Answer (English): Cash, debit card, Noqodi wallet and credit card are accepted.
Keywords: payment methods for real estate surveys

Question (English): How is the DLD fee calculated?
Answer (English): DLD Fees is 4% of the proeprty price. Registration Fees for properties valued below AED 500,000 = AED 2000 + 5% VAT. Registration Fees for properties valued above AED 500,000 = AED 4000 + 5% VAT.

Question (English): What documents are needed for a project's technical report?
Answer (English): Developers need to submit a construction agenda, financial report, actual completion rate report, and a building completion certificate from the planning authority.

Question (English): How can one update the data of owners who cannot access the application? How can an owner's data be updated outside the country?
Answer (English): The owners’ data can be updated by: 1. Contacting management company. 2. Contacting the call center at 8004488. 3. Raising a support ticket from DLD website. 4. Visiting real estate service trustee offices.
Question (Arabic): كيف يتم تحديث بيانات الملاك الذين لا يمكنهم الدخول إلى التطبيق؟ وكيف يمكن تحديث بيانات المالك خارج الدولة
Answer (Arabic): يمكن تحديث بيانات الملاك من خلال القنوات التالية:

Question (English): What are Mollak invoices?
Answer (English): Mollak invoices are issued directly by Dubai Land Department to owners of jointly owned properties. They come in two forms: service charge tax invoices or an additional-fee invoices. Invoice notifications must include a payment gateway to which an owner may settle their service charges online. Owners need not register with Mollak.
Question (Arabic): ما هي فاتورة ملاك؟
Answer (Arabic): تصدر فواتير ملاك من دائرة الأراضي والأملاك في دبي مباشرة إلى مالكي العقارات ذات الملكية المشتركة.

Question (English): How is a management company appointed?
Answer (English): As per Law (6) for 2019, jointly owned property projects fall under category 3; RERA is responsible for appointing Owner Association Management companies via its tenders in Mollak.
Question (Arabic): كيف يتم تعيين شركة الإدارة؟
Answer (Arabic): وفقًا للقانون 6 لعام 2019 ، يندرج أي مشروع عقاري مملوك بشكل مشترك ضمن الفئة 3 ، فإن مؤسسة التنظيم العقاري مسؤولة عن تعيين شركات إدارة اتحاد الملاك من خلال المناقصات التي طرحتها مؤسسة التنظيم العقاري في ملاك.

Question (English): What is the frequency of service-charge tax invoices?
Answer (English): Service-charge tax invoices are issued quarterly from Mollak by JOP management companies.
Question (Arabic): ما هو تكرار فاتورة ضريبة الخدمة؟
Answer (Arabic): يتم إصدار فواتير ضريبة رسوم الخدمة كل ثلاثة أشهر من نظام ملاك ، بواسطة شركات الإدارة.

Question (English): Who is responsible for issuing invoices and for the accuracy of the data?
Answer (English): The management and auditing companies. Dubai Land Department and RERA will not bear any responsibility for the accuracy of the data.
Question (Arabic): من المسؤول عن اصدار الفاتورة وعن دقة البيانات؟
Answer (Arabic): شركة الإدارة وشركة التدقيق هما المسؤولان عن إصدار الفواتير ودقة

Question (English): Can I refuse to pay service charges?
Answer (English): It is not permissible for any unit owner to refrain from paying charges for services duly imposed on them or for an item covered by the service charges. This includes, but is not limited to, the following: Whether or not common areas or common facilities are being used Whether or not a unit is occupied The administration's failure or delay in repairing or maintaining common areas
Question (Arabic): هل يمكنني رفض دفع رسوم الخدمة؟
Answer (Arabic): لا يجوز لمالك الوحدة الامتناع عن دفع رسوم بدل الخدمة أو بدل الاستخدام المفروض عليه أصولاً، أو عن صنف مشمول بعلاوة الخدمة أو رسم الاستخدام المفروض قانوناً لأي سبب من الأسباب. وهذا يشمل على سبيل المثال لا الحصر ما يلي:

Question (English): What happens if you don't pay service charges?
Answer (English): If an owner fails to pay their contribution of the service charges or any part thereof within 30 days of being notified, the management company shall refer the matter to the executive judge who has the right to sell the unit for which the fees have not been paid at a public auction to reimburse the fees.
Question (Arabic): ماذا يحدث إذا لم تدفع رسوم الخدمة؟
Answer (Arabic): إذا فشل المالك في دفع مساهمته في رسوم الخدمة أو أي جزء منها خلال 30 يومًا من إخطاره ، يجب على شركة الإدارة إحالة الأمر إلى القاضي التنفيذي الذي له الحق في بيع الوحدة التي لم يتم دفع الرسوم عنها. في مزاد علني لسداد الرسوم.

Question (English): How can I check the approved service charge rate for JOP?
Answer (English): You can check approved rates for service charges using the below link: https://dubailand.gov.ae/en/eservices/service-charge-index-overview/service-charge-index/#/
Question (Arabic): كيف يمكنني التحقق من معدل رسوم الخدمة المعتمد لـ JOP؟
Answer (Arabic): يمكنك التحقق من الأسعار المعتمدة باستخدام الرابط أدناه لرسوم الخدمة https://dubailand.gov.ae/en/eservices/service-charge-index-overview/service-charge-index/#/

Question (English): How can I view my service charge dues?
Answer (English): You can log in to the Dubai REST app as an owner and view your dues against properties owned by you. You can also view your account statement there.
Question (Arabic): كيف يمكنني الاطلاع على مستحقات رسوم الخدمة الخاصة بي؟
Answer (Arabic): يمكنك تسجيل الدخول إلى تطبيق Dubai REST بصفتك المالك وعرض مستحقاتك مقابل العقارات التي تمتلكها.

Question (English): What are the different channels for settling service charges?
Answer (English): You can pay via: Noqodi - Digital Wallet Net Banking Credit Card Al Ansari Exchange A deposit to the associated escrow account on the invoice A transfer to the escrow Account within the UAE: Major Exchange house (Al Fardan Exchange, LULU Exchange, Al Ghurair Exchange, etc)
Question (Arabic): ما هي قنوات الدفع المختلفة لرسوم الخدمة؟
Answer (Arabic): يمكنك الدفع عبر نقودي - المحفظة الرقمية / الخدمات المصرفية عبر الإنترنت / بطاقة الائتمان / الأنصاري للصرافة

Question (English): What are the Noqodi charges applied for service charges?
Answer (English): Digital Wallet - AED 2 + 5% VAT charges will be applied per transaction Net Banking - AED 5 + 5% VAT charges will be applied per transaction Credit Card - 1.5% + 5% VAT charges will be applied per invoice amount Al Ansari Exchange - AED 10 + VAT charges for each AED 25K transaction Payments received through this channel are automatically updated on Mollak
Question (Arabic): ما هي الرسوم المطبقة على نقودي لدفع رسوم الخدمة؟
Answer (Arabic): المحفظة الرقمية - سيتم تطبيق رسوم 2 درهم + 5٪ ضريبة القيمة المضافة لكل معاملة

Question (English): What are the escrow account charges applied for service charges?
Answer (English): Respective banking charges will be applied
Question (Arabic): ما هي الرسوم المطبقة على الإيداع في حساب الضمان لدفع رسوم الخدمة؟
Answer (Arabic): سيتم تطبيق الرسوم المصرفية المعنية

Question (English): What are the charges applied for escrow account transfers to settle service charges?
Answer (English): Respective transfer charges will be applied by exchange firms.
Question (Arabic): ما هي الرسوم المطبقة على التحويل إلى حساب الضمان لدفع رسوم الخدمة؟
Answer (Arabic): سيتم تطبيق رسوم التحويل المعنية من قبل شركات الصرافة

Question (English): How can I check my account statement?
Answer (English): log in to the Dubai REST app to view your statement against your owned properties. You can also contact your Owners' Association management company to issue an approved Mollak account statement.
Question (Arabic): كيف يمكنني التحقق من كشف الحساب الخاص بي؟
Answer (Arabic): تسجيل الدخول إلى تطبيق Dubai REST ويمكنك عرض نسخة كشف الحساب مقابل العقارات المملوكة لك.

Question (English): How can I update my contact details for invoicing purposes?
Answer (English): Contact your Owners' Association management company to update your details. You must also ensure that you details are updated in the DLD system by visiting any registration trustee/property trustee office
Question (Arabic): كيف أقوم بتحديث بيانات الاتصال الخاصة بي للفواتير؟
Answer (Arabic): لتحديث تفاصيل الاتصال الخاصة بك لغرض الفاتورة ، يرجى الاتصال بشركة إدارة جمعية الملاك لديك وتحديث التفاصيل.

Question (English): I haven't received a copy of my service charge invoice. Where can I request one?
Answer (English): Log in to the Dubai REST app as an owner and view your invoice issued against your properties. Otherwise, please contact your Owners' Association Management company.
Question (Arabic): لم أستلم نسخة فاتورة مصاريف الخدمة؟
Answer (Arabic): يمكنك تسجيل الدخول إلى تطبيق Dubai REST بصفتك المالك وعرض الفاتورة الصادرة مقابل عقاراتك أو  يرجى الاتصال بشركة إدارة جمعية الملاك في هذا الصدد.

Question (English): How do I register with an Owners' Committee?
Answer (English): You can register via the Dubai REST app, or you can contact a JOP management company. 1.       Download Dubai REST. 2.       Log in with you Emirates ID or title deed. 3.       After successful login, go to the dashboard 4.       Select the property. 5.       On the property screen, you will get an option to apply for services (click on red three dots) 6.       Select Owners' Committee registration 7.       Follow on-screen help and steps. 8.       Submit the request. 9.       Go to the 'my requests' section. 10.   Check the status of the request.
Question (Arabic): كيف أسجل في لجنة الملاك
Answer (Arabic): يمكنك التسجيل عبر تطبيق Dubai REST أو الاتصال بشركة إدارة JOP

Question (English): Can I register with an Owners' Committee if I do not have an Emirates ID?
Answer (English): No, you must have an Emirates ID and must be residing in the property.
Question (Arabic): هل يمكنني التسجيل في لجنة الملاك إذا لم يكن لدي هوية الإمارات؟
Answer (Arabic): للتسجيل في لجنة الملاك ، يجب أن يكون لديك هوية إماراتية ويجب أن تكون مقيمًا في العقار

Question (English): Can I register with an Owners' Committee if I my property is rented?
Answer (English): No
Question (Arabic): هل يمكنني التسجيل في لجنة الملاك إذا كان العقار الخاص بي مستأجراً؟
Answer (Arabic): لا يمكنك الترشح للجنة الملاك إذا كان العقار مستأجرا.

Question (English): Am I eligible to apply for an Owners' Committee if I own a unit that is leased under my name?
Answer (English): To apply for an Owners' Committee as a unit owner, you need to submit the required documents along with a copy of the tenant's trade license, the ownership certificate for verification, and copies of the Ejari and confirmation letters from the JOP management company.
Question (Arabic): هل أنا مؤهل للتقدم بطلب للجنة المالك في حال امتلكت وحدة وتم تأجيرها باسمي؟
Answer (Arabic): للتقدم بطلب للحصول على لجنة الملاك ، إذا كنت مالكًا لوحدة ما ، فأنت بحاجة إلى تقديم المستندات المطلوبة جنبًا إلى جنب مع نسخة من الرخصة التجارية للمستأجر مع شهادة الملكية للتحقق ، ونسخة إيجاري وخطاب التأكيد من شركة الإدارة المشتركة

Question (English): What can I do if while settling a payment via Noqodi, the wrong email or mobile information is displayed?
Answer (English): While settling the payment via Noqodi, you have the option to update your email address and mobile number to receive the payment receipt on.
Question (Arabic): أثناء إجراء الدفع عبر نقودي ، تظهر البوابة بريدًا إلكترونيًا وجوالًا خاطئين؟
Answer (Arabic): أثناء إجراء الدفع عبر نقودي ، لديك خيار تحديث البريد الإلكتروني والجوال لاستلام إيصال الدفع.

Question (English): How can I raise a complaint against my JOP management company?
Answer (English): You can register your complaint in our Real Estate Violation System: https://rvs.dubailand.gov.ae/ or via the Dubai REST app. Select from the below categories, and submit your complaint: Claiming Service Charges Preventing or discontinuing the use of common-area services Preventing or discontinuing air conditioning within a unit Poor service provided to the JOP Not responding to customer enquiries JOP management company's failure to clarify the amounts of previous service charges in the Mollak system. Increase in service fees The absence of a RERA-approved JOP Management company managing the JOP
Question (Arabic): كيف يمكنني رفع شكوى ضد شركة إدارة العقارت الخاصة بي؟
Answer (Arabic): في حالة وجود نتيجة لشكوى ضد شركة إدارة جمعية الملاك ، يمكنك تسجيل شكواك في نظام المخالفات العقارية لدينا: https://rvs.dubailand.gov.ae/

Question (English): Where can I find the bank details to settle my service charges?
Answer (English): You can find the bank account details on the invoice that was issued from Mollak by JOP management companies.
Question (Arabic): أين يمكنني العثور على التفاصيل المصرفية لدفع رسوم الخدمة الخاصة بي؟
Answer (Arabic): تفاصيل الحساب المصرفي المذكورة في فاتورتك الصادرة من مالك من قبل شركات إدارة العقارات المشتركة

Question (English): I received multiple invoices with different amounts. Which one should I pay?
Answer (English): Please proceed to pay the latest invoice received as it is inclusive of balances from all the previous invoices.
Question (Arabic): استلمت فواتير متعددة بمبالغ مختلفة ، أي واحدة يجب أن أدفعها؟
Answer (Arabic): يُرجى المتابعة لدفع آخر فاتورة مستلمة ، حيث إنها تشمل أرصدة من جميع الفواتير السابقة

Question (English): I am receiving an error when trying to pay - did the business application Expire?
Answer (English): You are currently trying to pay via a deferred invoice link. Please refer to the latest invoice copy or contact your Owners' Association management company for a copy of the latest invoice.
Question (Arabic): أتلقى خطأ أثناء الدفع - هل انتهت صلاحية تطبيق الأعمال؟
Answer (Arabic): حاليًا ، أنت تحاول الدفع عبر رابط للفاتورة المؤجلة.

Question (English): Why is the developer's name/bank name appearing on the invoice along with owner's name?
Answer (English): In case of a lease/payment plan on a property with a developer, respective beneficiary relations will be displayed on the invoice.
Question (Arabic): اسم المطور / اسم البنك يظهر على الفاتورة مع اسم المالك؟
Answer (Arabic): في حالة خطة الإيجار / الدفع على عقار مع المطور ، سيتم عرض علاقات المستفيدين المعنية على الفاتورة.

Question (English): How can I find details for jointly owned property management companies?
Answer (English): please refer to the following link: https://dubailand.gov.ae/en/eservices/jointly-owned-property-management-companies/jointly-owned-property-management-companies-form/#/
Question (Arabic): كيف يمكنني العثور على تفاصيل عن شركات إدارة العقارات ذات الملكية المشتركة؟

Answer (Arabic): الرجاء الرجوع إلى الرابط:

Question (English): Which auditors are considered certified escrow agents registered in Mollak?
Answer (English): please refer to the following link: https://dubailand.gov.ae/en/eservices/certified-auditors/certified-auditors-list/#/

Answer (Arabic): الرجاء الرجوع إلى الرابط:

Question (English): How can I apply for an eNOC?
Answer (English): As of 2021, there is no need to apply for an eNOC through the Mollak/Dubai REST system for approved sale budgets of a property. eNOCs will still be required for unapproved budgets. It is the responsibility of the management company to ensure the account statement is updated on the system. Follow these steps: 1. Log in to Dubai REST as an owner 2. Go to your dashboard 3. Select your property to apply for the eNOC service (on the property screen, you will get an option to apply for services (click on red three dots) 4. select eNOC Request 5. Submit the request 6. You will be notified once your request is approved or rejected by the management company
Question (Arabic): كيف يمكنني التقدم بطلب للحصول على شهادة عدم ممانعة الالكترونية ؟
Answer (Arabic): ليست هناك حاجة لتقديم طلب للحصول على إجراء e-Noc من خلال نظام Mollak / Dubai REST للميزانيات المعتمدة لعام 2021 وما بعده لبيع العقار.

Question (English): What are the conditions for approvals/required documents for Owners' Committee nominations?
Answer (English): Conditions for application approval: Photograph Good conduct certificate issued by Dubai Police
Question (Arabic): ما هي شروط القبول / المستندات المطلوبة للترشح للجنة الملاك؟
Answer (Arabic): شروط قبول الطلبات:

Question (English): What does negative due amount mean on service charge invoices?
Answer (English): It is the credit balance. It means that no payment will be require for the current invoice.
Question (Arabic): ماذا يعني المبلغ المستحق السالب في فاتورة رسوم الخدمة؟
Answer (Arabic): المبلغ المستحق السالب يعني أنه رصيد دائن ولا يوجد دفع معلق للفاتورة الحالية.

Question (English): How can I get refund for over-paid service charges?
Answer (English): The Owners' Association management company will have to issue a credit note for the balance to be settled against next quarter's invoice.
Question (Arabic): كيف يمكنني استرداد رسوم الخدمة المدفوعة؟
Answer (Arabic): في حالة زيادة رسوم الخدمة المدفوعة ، يمكن لشركة إدارة اتحاد الملاك إصدار إشعار دائن وسيتم تسوية الرصيد مقابل فاتورة الربع التالي.

Question (English): What is the time frame to settle service charges?
Answer (English): You have 30 days from the date of issue of the invoice to pay the service charges.
Question (Arabic): ما هو الإطار الزمني لدفع رسوم الخدمة؟
Answer (Arabic): لديك 30 يومًا من تاريخ إصدار الفاتورة لدفع رسوم الخدمة

Question (English): If service charges are not paid within the time frame, what are the consequences?
Answer (English): If the charges are not settled 30 days from the issue date of the invoice, the management company can issue a legal notice against the owner.
Question (Arabic): إذا لم يتم دفع رسوم الخدمة ضمن الإطار الزمني ، فما هي العواقب؟
Answer (Arabic): بعد 30 يومًا من تاريخ إصدار الفاتورة ، يمكن لشركة الإدارة إصدار إشعار قانوني ضد المالك.

Question (English): What is a legal notice?
Answer (English): Legal notices are issued with the consent of RERA (Real Estate Regulatory Authority), stating that strict legal action will be pursued in local courts if owners continue to not pay their dues.
Question (Arabic): ما هو الإشعار القانوني؟
Answer (Arabic): يتم إصدار إشعار قانوني بموافقة مؤسسة التنظيم العقاري (RERA) ، ينص على أنه سيتم اتخاذ إجراء قانوني صارم في المحاكم المحلية إذا استمر المالكون في اتخاذ موقف عدم الدفع.

Question (English): Understanding your Invoice.
Answer (English): Please reach out to your Owners' Association management company for more information regarding your Invoice.
Question (Arabic): فهم فاتورتك.
Answer (Arabic): يُرجى التواصل مع شركة إدارة اتحاد الملاك للحصول على فهم مفصل لفاتورتك.

Question (English): What is a JOP (jointly owned property)?
Answer (English): A Jointly owned property refers to “the whole or any part of a building or land, or both, which is divided into units intended for separate ownership where parts of such building or land are designated as common areas
Question (Arabic): ما هي العقارات المشتركة (JOP)؟
Answer (Arabic): تشير العقارات المملوكة بشكل مشترك إلى "كل أو أي جزء من المبنى أو الأرض ، أو كليهما ، والتي تنقسم إلى وحدات مخصصة لملكية منفصلة حيث يتم تخصيص أجزاء من هذا المبنى أو الأرض كمناطق مشتركة

Question (English): What are the steps needed to complete a project registration in Mollak?
Answer (English): 1. Create a 'land access request' (LAR). 2. Once the LAR is approved by RERA, you can proceed to create a property group. 3. Once the property group is submitted to and approved by RERA, an automated task will be created in the system. 4. Complete the process by selecting agreement period. 5. Once RERA approves, upload the required documents, select the bank, select the account holder (developer/ management company) and submit for RERA's approval. 6. Once RERA approves, the request will be placed in a bank queue to open JOPD bank account.
Question (Arabic): ما هو التسلسل المطلوب إتباعه لإتمام تسجيل المشروع في ملاك؟
Answer (Arabic): 1. إنشاء LAR.

Question (English): Why do we require a reserve fund?
Answer (English): A reserve fund not only meets legal, fiduciary and professional requirements but also minimizes the need for special assessments and enhances resale values. Every association requires a different amount of cash in its reserves to complete repair or replacement project schedules without special assessments or loans.
Question (Arabic): لماذا نحتاج إلى صندوق احتياطي؟
Answer (Arabic): إن الاحتفاظ بصندوق احتياطي لا يلبي المتطلبات القانونية والائتمانية والمهنية فحسب ، بل يقلل أيضًا من الحاجة إلى تقييمات خاصة ويعزز قيم إعادة البيع. يتطلب من كل جمعية مبلغًا مختلفًا من النقد في الاحتياطيات لإكمال جدول أعمال الإصلاح أو الاستبدال بدون تقييمات خاصة أو قروض.

Question (English): What is the main goal of the agency (RERA)?
Answer (English): To set policies, plans and create awareness of the real estate sector in Dubai in order to increase foreign investments and provide a centralized address that will secure everyone involved in the property market.
Question (Arabic): ما هو الهدف الرئيسي لمؤسسة التنظيم العقاري "ريرا"؟
Answer (Arabic): وضع السياسات والخطط وخلق الوعي بقطاع العقارات في دبي من أجل زيادة الاستثمارات الأجنبية، وتوفير عنوان رئيسي ومركزي يكون وجهة آمنة لكل من يساهم في سوق العقارات.

Question (English): How can I register for 'land access request' in Mollak?
Answer (English): Once logged in to Mollak as management company, click on 'land access request.' Fill the template and submit for RERA's approval.
Question (Arabic): كيف يمكنني التسجيل في طلب الحصول على تصريح حصول على بيانات  أرض في ملاك؟
Answer (Arabic): بمجرد تسجيل الدخول إلى mollak كشركة إدارة ، انقر فوق Land Access request.

Question (English): Where can I find the area name, land number and sub number to fill in the 'land access request' template?
Answer (English): Refer to Land Title deed for details regarding area names and land numbers/plot numbers and complete the template accordingly.
Question (Arabic): أين يمكنني العثور على اسم المنطقة ورقم الأرض والرقم الفرعي لملء نموذج طلب الوصول إلى الأرض؟
Answer (Arabic): الرجوع إلى سند ملكية الأرض للحصول على تفاصيل عن اسم المنطقة ورقم الأرض / رقم قطعة الأرض وملء النموذج وفقًا لذلك.

Question (English): How can I create a new property group?
Answer (English): Log in to Mollak, click on 'Property Group' on the dashboard and select 'create new.' Fill in the required details, select property group types, and enter the approved LAR number. Make sure to select 'properties fetched' before submitting the request for RERA's approval.
Question (Arabic): كيف يتم إنشاء مجموعة عقارات جديدة؟
Answer (Arabic): تسجيل الدخول إلى Mollak ، انقر على خيار Property Group في لوحة التحكم وانقر على إنشاء جديد.

Question (English): How can I create a service-charge period?
Answer (English): 1. Click on 'Bank details' 2. Search for the project 3. Click on the 'service charge icon' 4. Select 'REUSE' 5. Click on 'Define service charges' 6. Click on 'Create New' 7. Click on Submit 8. Select the period details 9. Click submits.
Question (Arabic): كيف يمكنني تحديد فترة رسوم الخدمة؟
Answer (Arabic): انقر فوق تفاصيل البنك - ابحث عن مشروع - انقر فوق رمز رسوم الخدمة مقابله - على الشاشة ، مقابل مجموعات رسوم الخدمة ، حدد إعادة الاستخدام - انقر فوق تحديد رسوم الخدمة - انقر فوق إنشاء قريب - انقر فوق إرسال - حدد تفاصيل الفترة في النموذج (حدد التواريخ) - إرسال.

Question (English): How can I select and auditor for a created service-charge period?
Answer (English): You must first create a budget Auditor Assignment request. Once request it is approved by an auditor and RERA, the auditor's name will automatically be displayed in the dropdown list.
Question (Arabic): كيف يتم اختيار المدقق لرسوم الخدمات المحددة بالفترة الزمنية؟
Answer (Arabic): يجب عليك أولاً إنشاء طلب تعيين المراجع لنوع الموازنة.

Question (English): When do we upload liabilities for a property group?
Answer (English): Liabilities are only to be uploaded for the first-time invoicing of a project from Mollak. Once you start invoicing, all the balances will be carried forward.
Question (Arabic): متى نقوم بتحميل الالتزامات لمجموعة العقارات؟
Answer (Arabic): يتم تحميل الالتزامات فقط عند إصدار فواتير لأول مرة للمشروع من Mollak.

Question (English): How can I pay receipts in Mollak?
Answer (English): Manage --> Manage a property group --> Search for the project --> property group actions--> Receipts --> download and complete the form --> upload.
Question (Arabic): كيف يمكنني دفع الإيصالات في ملاك؟
Answer (Arabic): انتقل إلى إدارة - إدارة مجموعة الخصائص - ابحث عن مشروع - ضمن إجراءات مجموعة الخصائص - ضمن الإيصالات ، قم بتنزيل النموذج وقم بملئه وتحميله.

Question (English): How can I do a receipt reversal?
Answer (English): Under' manage property group,' download the receipts template and upload the receipt details with the same reference number and date that was uploaded before but with the receipt amount as negative. Also, note that you cannot apply for a reverse receipt if it has been settled in the Invoicing. - In this case, you can upload an additional invoice as an adjustment.
Question (Arabic): كيف يمكنني إبطال الإيصال؟
Answer (Arabic): يمكنك إجراء إبطال الإيصالات للإيصالات التي تم تحميلها بشكل خاطئ.

Question (English): How can I add an employee/role in Mollak?
Answer (English): Log in to Mollak, click on Administration -- Add Employee -- Select Department and role -- Search using Emirates ID-- upload the required documents -- Submit for RERA's approval.
Question (Arabic): كيف يمكنني إضافة موظف / أدوار في ملاك؟
Answer (Arabic): تسجيل الدخول إلى Mollak ، انقر فوق الإدارة - إضافة موظف - تحديد القسم والوظيفة - البحث باستخدام هوية الإمارات - تحميل المستندات المطلوبة وإرسالها للحصول على موافقة مؤسسة التنظيم العقاري.

Question (English): Where can I update a company's contact information and TRN?
Answer (English): Log in to Mollak, click on Administration -- Manage Company. From here, you can update email/ mobile/phone/address and company TRN.
Question (Arabic): أين يمكنني تحديث معلومات الاتصال بالشركة و TRN؟
Answer (Arabic): تسجيل الدخول إلى Mollak ، انقر فوق الإدارة - إدارة الشركة - ويمكنك تحديث البريد الإلكتروني / الجوال / الهاتف / العنوان و TRN للشركة.

Question (English): Where can I upload the company logo?
Answer (English): Log in to Mollak, click on Administration -- Manage Company-- and you can upload a logo in the following format: JPEG/PNG , size 167px X 90px
Question (Arabic): أين يمكنني تحميل شعار الشركة؟
Answer (Arabic): تسجيل الدخول إلى Mollak ، انقر فوق الإدارة - إدارة الشركة - ويمكنك تحميل الشعار بتنسيق JPEG / PNG ، الحجم 167 بكسل × 90 بكسل

Question (English): in case of a single villa on a land, is invoicing issued for the villa or the land?
Answer (English): For the villa. However, if the villa is not registered on the land, then the invoicing will be issued for the land.
Question (Arabic): في حالة وجود فيلا مفردة على الأرض ، يتم عمل الفواتير على الفيلا أو الأرض؟
Answer (Arabic): في حالة الفيلا المنفردة على الأرض ، يتم إصدار الفواتير في الفيلا.

Question (English): How is an approved amount calculated in a legal notice?
Answer (English): The approved amount for legal notices is calculated by taking the invoice due amount (against the relevant invoice) minus any receipt uploaded to the system, (payment date of receipt) after the invoice, even if it is settled in invoicing.
Question (Arabic): كيف يتم حساب المبلغ المعتمد في الإشعار القانوني؟
Answer (Arabic): لحساب المبلغ المعتمد للإشعار القانوني ، فإنه يأخذ مبلغ الفاتورة المستحقة (للفاتورة التي تقدم بموجبها إشعارًا قانونيًا) مطروحًا منه أي إيصال تم تحميله في النظام ، (تاريخ استلام الدفع) بعد الفاتورة ، حتى إذا تم تسويتها في الفواتير.

Question (English): Can we raise legal notice against any invoice? (actual/provisional)
Answer (English): you can only raise a legal notice against actual invoices.
Question (Arabic): هل يمكننا رفع إشعار قانوني ضد أي فاتورة (فعلية / مؤقتة)
Answer (Arabic): يمكنك رفع إشعار قانوني ضد الفاتورة الفعلية فقط ، وليس الفاتورة المؤقتة.

Question (English): How are villas invoiced?
Answer (English): Villas are invoiced according to their built-up area.
Question (Arabic): في حالة الفلل ، في أي منطقة يتم عمل الفواتير؟
Answer (Arabic): بالنسبة للفيلات ، يتم إصدار الفواتير على المساحة المبنية من الفيلا.

Question (English): My property was blocked due to the non-payment of service charges. I have cleared my dues, but my property is still blocked.
Answer (English): Check if there is an active legal notice issued from your Owners' Association management company. Contact your management company for legal-notice cancellation to unblock it.
Question (Arabic): تم حظر مكان الإقامة الخاص بي بسبب عدم دفع رسوم الخدمة. لقد قمت بتصفية المستحقات ، ولكن ما زلت أحجب العروض؟
Answer (Arabic): يُرجى التحقق مما إذا كان هناك إشعار قانوني نشط صادر عن شركة إدارة اتحاد المالك.

Question (English): How can I issue a legal notice to an owner?
Answer (English): Legal notices can only be issued from a company manager's account. Under 'property invoices,' search for 'invoice' and under 'actions,' click on 'Send legal notice.'  Click on the 'Submit' button for the legal notice to be sent to owner. Once sent,  you will be able to download the notice under 'property invoices.'
Question (Arabic): كيف يمكنني إصدار إشعار قانوني للمالك؟
Answer (Arabic): يمكن إنشاء إشعار قانوني فقط من خلال تسجيل دخول مدير الشركة.

Question (English): What are Virtual Accounts in Mollak?
Answer (English): This kind of logical account, and allow only for the deposit aswell linked to main account. Property accounts are created for all  projects associated with bank, each has unique IBAN number (virtual account) displayed on the owners invoice. When a payment is made by the owner to the mentioned account number, within the duration of a bank processing payment to your account, a receipt will be generated in Mollak; you need not upload a manual receipt in this case. In case the receipt has NOT been reflected, cross-check with bank.
Question (Arabic): ما هي الحسابات الافتراضية في ملاك؟
Answer (Arabic): بالنسبة لجميع المشاريع مع بنك أبوظبي التجاري ، تم إنشاء حسابات عقارات ، وبالتالي بالنسبة لكل عقار ، يتم عرض حساب بنكي خاص بالعقارات الفريدة (حساب افتراضي) على فاتورة المالكين ، والتي يتم تعيينها في الواجهة الخلفية للحساب المصرفي لمجموعة العقارات الرئيسية.

Question (English): What is the duration of a service charge?
Answer (English): The service charge period is usually for one year.
Question (Arabic): ما هي فترة رسوم الخدمة؟
Answer (Arabic): غالبًا ما تكون فترة رسوم الخدمة لمدة عام. وهي المدة التي سيتم تحديد الميزانية من خلالها.

Question (English): What is a 'service charge group'?
Answer (English): Service charge groups are a segregation and selection of properties under different groups by defining their usage. Each group will have separate service charge budget defined.
Question (Arabic): ما هي مجموعة رسوم الخدمة؟
Answer (Arabic): مجموعات رسوم الخدمة عبارة عن فصل واختيار خصائص ضمن مجموعات مختلفة من خلال تحديد استخدامها.

Question (English): What is a 'service charge budget'?
Answer (English): Manage --> Manage property group --> Search for project --> property group actions--> receipts --> download the template.
Question (Arabic): ما هي ميزانية رسوم الخدمة؟
Answer (Arabic): انتقل إلى إدارة - إدارة مجموعة العقارات - ابحث عن مشروع - ضمن إجراءات مجموعة الملكية - ضمن الإيصالات ، قم بتنزيل النموذج وقم بملئه وتحميله.

Question (English): What is a 'provisional service charge'?
Answer (English): Any budget period defined with provisionally approved rates is a provisional service charge.
Question (Arabic): ما هي رسوم الخدمة المؤقتة؟
Answer (Arabic): أي فترة ميزانية محددة بالمعدلات المعتمدة مؤقتًا هي رسوم خدمة مؤقتة

Question (English): What is a provisionally billed period?
Answer (English): Any uploaded budget, which has been billed provisionally (for any quarter) by defined rates by RERA, is a provisionally billed budget.
Question (Arabic): ما هي فترة الفاتورة المؤقتة؟
Answer (Arabic): بالنسبة إلى أي ميزانية تم تحميلها ، والتي تم إصدار فاتورتها مؤقتًا (لأي ربع سنة) بمعدلات محددة من قبل مؤسسة التنظيم العقاري.

Question (English): What are the mandatory roles required to register an approved company in Mollak?
Answer (English): Company Manager Financial Department - Financial Manager Owners Affairs Department - Director of Owners Affairs Facility Management Department - Director of Facility Management
Question (Arabic): ما هي مسميات الوظيفية التي يتوجب تقديمها لغرض تسجيل الشركة في نظام ملاك ؟
Answer (Arabic): مدير الشركة

Question (English): What details do I need to update in the property contact template?
Answer (English): Owner Mobile (should NOT include any special characters, (format example 00971512345678), if no data is available, input 0) Owner's email (mandatory) Owner's Emirates ID (should NOT include any special character (format example: 784199012345678), if no data is available, input 0) Owner's passport number (if no data available, input 0) Owner's address (if no data available, input 0) TRN (if no data is available, input 0) – If the TRN is mentioned, owner's address is MANDATORY. Please DO NOT change any other fields apart from above mentioned.
Question (Arabic): ما هي التفاصيل التي أحتاج إلى تحديثها في نموذج جهة اتصال الملكية
Answer (Arabic): المالك المحمول (يجب ألا يتضمن أي حرف خاص ، (مثال على التنسيق 00971512345678) ، في حالة عدم توفر بيانات ، الإدخال 0)

Question (English): Where can I update the owner's TRN displayed on the Invoice?
Answer (English): Owner TRN/address can be updated in the property group template.
Question (Arabic): أين يتم تحديث المالك TRN لعرضه على الفاتورة؟
Answer (Arabic): يرجى تحديث المالك TRN / العنوان في نموذج مجموعة العقارات.

Question (English): Where can I download account statements in Mollak?
Answer (English): Log in to Mollak --> Manage--> Manage property group --> Search for project--> property group actions --> search properties-->Actions against property --> Account Statement
Question (Arabic): أين يمكننا تحميل نسخة من كشف الحساب في ملاك؟
Answer (Arabic): تسجيل الدخول إلى mollak ، انقر فوق إدارة - إدارة مجموعة العقارات - البحث عن مشروع - ضمن إجراءات مجموعة الملكية - خصائص البحث - انقر فوق إجراءات ضد الملكية - كشف الحساب

Question (English): What is the owner committee?
Answer (English): This is the independence committee , having administrative and monitoring offer management performance. Every JOP RERA encouraging apartment owner to participate as committee members, and among them chairman & vice chairman will be selected

Question (English): What are the required conditions for having an owner committee membership?
Answer (English): 1. To have full legal capacity. 2. To be one of the owners residing in the joint property. 3. To be of good conduct. 4. To be committed to pay the service fee and the use fee. 5. to continuously attend the meetings of the owners committee and participate actively in its sessions.

Question (English): What is the management company?
Answer (English): It is the company licensed according to the system and approved by the Real Estate Regulatory Agency (RERA), and is based on the management of joint facilities, joint properties or the shared parts of the project.

Question (English): What is the service allowance?
Answer (English): The annual financial fee approved by the Real Estate Regulatory Agency (RERA), collected from the owner of real estate units to cover the expenses of managing, operating, maintaining and repairing the joint property, and is subject to monitoring and auditing according to the applicable system.

Question (English): What is the use allowance?
Answer (English): The annual financial allowance approved by the Real Estate Regulatory Agency (RERA), collected from the owners to cover the management, operation, maintenance and repair of the shared facilities in the main real estate project.

Question (English): What are the shared services fees?
Answer (English): It is the services allowance audited by the legal auditing offices approved by the Real Estate Regulatory Agency (RERA), which are payable by owners of real estate units in jointly owned projects in return for operating and managing shared areas and facilities. That include the following: 1. services fees (such as: guarding, internal and external cleaning.... etc.) 2. Maintenance fees (all types of maintenance contracts) 3. Utility charges (electricity, water, air conditioning) 4. Administration fees. 5. Insurance fees. 6. The main development complex fees (use fee) 7. Reserve fees (according to the law, an amount is collected annually for emergencies and major repairs after a long period of time)

Question (English): How to calculate the shared services fees for the property owner?
Answer (English): The owner’s share of the shared services fees is calculated according to the area owned by him in his title deed of the real estate unit after distributing the total cost of the shared services fees to all owners of real estate units in the project, each according to the area owned by him. (It is also possible for the owner to get an estimate for shared services fees approved by Real Estate Regulatory Agency “RERA”, through the department’s website with the shared services fees index, multiplying it by the real estate unit area, and obtaining the total fees for shared services approved by the Agency).

Question (English): What is the specialized entity in approving the shared services fees for projects?
Answer (English): The budget allocated for the service allowance, or the use allowance is approved by the Real Estate Regulatory Agency, after completing the audit from one of the legal auditing offices approved and audited by the Real Estate Regulatory Agency (RERA).

Question (English): Do the maintenance and services fees change from one project to another?
Answer (English): Yes, the fees for services and maintenance differ from one project to another depending on the type of services provided in the main building or complex, the size of the common spaces, and the size and number of real estate units sold.

Question (English): Does the owner have to pay the shared services fees even if not approved by RERA?
Answer (English): RERA requires management bodies not to claim service fees until after they are approved by RERA. In the event that owners demand unapproved service fees, legal measures will be taken against violators.

Question (English): What is the entity to which owners and tenants turn to in cases of inquiries or complaints related to low maintenance and services?
Answer (English): For inquiries, they can refer to the Land Department’s website or contact the call center. For complaints related to the low level of services and maintenance in the project, the owners of the detached units can submit a complaint through the "Dubai Rest" application and access the complaints service and submit it.

Question (English): From where to get information for shared services fees?
Answer (English): Visit Dubai Land Department’s website www.dubailand.gov.ae
Keywords: such as information related to service fee

Question (English): Where should the service fee be paid?
Answer (English): Services fees are paid to the accounts approved by the Real Estate Regulatory Agency, after the customer receives an e-mail message or a text message from the Owner System that allows detached units owner to use the approved electronic channels to pay the service fees.

Question (English): Who is responsible for the owners in the event of managing a joint property?
Answer (English): The management company is the entity responsible for managing the joint property and managing the owners’ affairs in all matters related to the management of the joint project and public utilities, receiving inquiries and complaints from the owners of the project and working to resolve them.

Question (English): How to act in the event of services cut off for tenants or owners?
Answer (English): In the case of tenants: refer to the Dispute Resolution Center to get an immediate decision from the judge to restore the service (petition order). In the case of owners: file a complaint through the “Dubai Rest” application, by entering the filing a complaint service and filing your complaint.

Question (English): How are owners association management supervision services companies registered in RERA?
Answer (English): The company is registered by following these steps: 1. Visit the website www.dubailand.gov.ae 2. Choose Login to the system > New user > Register as a business user. 3. Choose an owner. 4. Fill out the electronic form.

Question (English): What is the purpose of Owner (Owner System)
Answer (English): The main objective of the Owner System is to apply the real estate governance system to the real estate sector of joint ownership, to regulate the work of management companies and to monitor service fees in joint properties in the Emirate of Dubai.

Question (English): Available services in Owner (Owner System)
Answer (English): 1. Registration of management companies. 2. Registration of employees working in management companies. 3. Registration of management contracts. 4. Registration of statutory financial auditors. 5. Registration of financial institutions (banks). 6. Registration of the real estate complex in the system. 7. Request to open a regulatory bank account for the real estate complex. 8. Request for approval of service charges. 9. Issuance of utility fee invoices through the system for real estate unit owners. 10. Providing approved electronic payment methods.

Question (English): Services fees payments methods (Owner System)
Answer (English): Service fee bills can be paid through the payment options listed below: First Payment Option Pay the service fees by depositing the amount in the regulatory bank account mentioned in the invoice directly and with the need for the owner to notify the project management company. -Where can I find the details of the regulatory bank account of the joint property? Escrow account information is on the invoice. -Do I need to inform my management company after making the transfer to the regulatory bank account? Yes, you must present the payment voucher to your management company via email or in person to the management company. -Where can I find the email address to send the payment voucher? The email address is located on the last part of the invoice. Second Payment Option (Net-Banking, Credit Card, e-Wallet) Pay through Noqodi.

Question (English): Additional information about Owner System published in the media:
Answer (English): The Land Department has succeeded in developing the Owner System internally as part of its continuous efforts to upgrade the real estate sector and provide the best services at the highest levels and international standards, relying on its staff capabilities of dealing with the latest technologies. The Owner System is the first of its kind in the world that provides a new and integrated system for controlling accounts related to service fees and offering support services to all parties involved in joint properties in Dubai. The system works through a group of stakeholders in the management of joint properties. It also works within the database of real estate unit owners and the database of real estate units registered and approved by the Dubai Land Department, where no user may change the data. The system includes innovative features and has succeeded in attracting owners of jointly owned real estate to manage their projects easily at the required speed. It also helps simplify real estate registration and standardize its regulatory processes, to ensure laws and regulatory guidelines compliance, increase transparency in the real estate industry and increase investor confidence. In addition, it helps to simplify the process of collecting service fees, by coordinating with the records of the Dubai Land Department to ensure accuracy and easy access to property records and the owners database. It works to provide a unified database to store and update all relevant records, which leads to enhancing sustainability in the real estate environment.

Question (English): How to update the owner’s data when access the application is not possible? How can the owner's data be updated when he resides outside the country?
Answer (English): Owners' data can be updated through the following channels: 1. Contacting the department’s call center on the number 8004488

Question (English): Can I become committee  member of 2 of my apartments?
Answer (English): Not possible, one resident can be part of one JOP only

Question (English): What are the bank support Virtual Accounts?
Answer (English): ADCB

Question (English): What is General Fund?
Answer (English): The budget calculations depend on the level of service provided in the building and variables like location, security, landscaping and maintenance for common areas are also factored in. This entails that a property with luxurious units and common areas, will require a higher budget, that account fund called as General Fund. This fund is used to pay for the scheduled maintenance that secures the upkeep of the building.

Question (English): What are violations in Mollak?
Answer (English): Companies can issue community violations from Mollak. Each violation category can have different fine and impact based on the regulations defined by RERA in Mollak. Violations can result in warning, fine and double fine. The duration for converting warning to fine and then double fine are all controlled by RERA and are mentioned on the notices sent to owners. Financial penalties are posted in owner account statement.

Question (English): What happens if owner doesn't pay for violation?
Answer (English): It depends on the policy governed by RERA. The next action is mentioned on the notice received for the violation.

Question (English): How can owners pay for violations?
Answer (English): Violations can be paid via payment link sent in email, or directly to the management companies.

Question (English): Are tenants responsible for violations?
Answer (English): No, as of now. Owners are requested to settle for violations with tenants.

Question (English): Can owner respond to the violation?
Answer (English): Yes, owners can respond to the violations via dubai rest mobile app. The owners have multiple options to apply:

Question (English): Is there an official channel for owners to provide feedback or register complaints against management companies?
Answer (English): Yes. The service is termed as Mollak Gateway Services (aka JOP services). Owners can interact with this service from DLD webiste or Dubai Rest app.

Question (English): Unable to view Mollak Gateway Services option
Answer (English): This option is available only for managed free hold properties.

Question (English): Who can use Mollak Gateway Services?
Answer (English): Owners and tenants both can use this service. However, categories vary tenants and owners.

Question (English): What happens after owner registers a complain in Mollak Gateway Services?
Answer (English): Complaint will route to management company to respond. There is a fixed time period to respond as mentioned in the notice email.

Question (English): What if management company does not respond or the response is unsatisfied?
Answer (English): After the allowed duration for the company to respond, complainant can provide the feedback an escalate the request to RERA.

Question (English): Is my personal data secure once I login with emirates id or passport information?
Answer (English): Yes, the Dubai Land website follows stringent security protocols to ensure that your personal and transaction data is protected. It uses encryption and secure login methods, such as OTP (One-Time Password) and biometric authentication like UAE pass support government authentication method, to safeguard your information.

Question (English): Can I pay real estate fees and fines through the site?
Answer (English): Yes, you can pay various fees, including property registration, transaction fees, and fines, directly through the website. The payment process is integrated with secure payment gateways like noqodi for easy and safe transactions.

Question (English): Can I access my property documents through the site?

Question (English): Can I get a mortgage or financing for a property through the website?
Answer (English): Currently, the website does not offer direct mortgage services. However, the app allows you request to specific bank for mortgage quotation. Further, you would need to approach banks or financial institutions directly. The app may provide guidance on this process, but the financing itself would be handled externally.
